options.content:
# RED Method Analyses for MySQL Query Performance 

This dashboard accesses data in Clickhouse directly.  Use Filters for ad-hoc filtering of the data set
For More Information on READ Method Check Out  [RED Method](https://thenewstack.io/monitoring-microservices-red-method/)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(num_queries)/avg(period_length) as QPS
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(num_queries_with_errors)/sum(num_queries) as ErrorRate
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt) as AvgLatency,
    avg(m_query_time_p99) as p99Latency
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(num_queries)/avg(period_length) as QPS,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(num_queries_with_errors)/sum(num_queries) as ErrorRate,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name 
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt) as AvgLatency,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(num_queries)/avg(period_length) as QPS
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and node_name='$NodeName'
GROUP BY t
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(num_queries_with_errors)/sum(num_queries) as ErrorRate
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and node_name='$NodeName'
GROUP BY t
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt) as AvgLatency,
    avg(m_query_time_p99) as p99Latency
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and node_name='$NodeName'
GROUP BY t
ORDER BY t

panels.description: Number of Rows Examined per Row Sent to the client or modified.   The lower the number the more efficiently database is doing the work.  Values above 100 tend to correspond to missing indexes or inefficient queries which crunch a lot of data

custom.axisLabel: Rows Examined Per Row Sent or Affected

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum)/sum(m_rows_sent_sum+m_rows_affected_sum) as Rows_exam_per_action,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

panels.title: Row Based Efficiency (Total)

panels.description: Average time it takes for database to produce row to sent to client or  modify row.   When database is running efficiently it should take fraction of millisecond

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_rows_sent_sum+m_rows_affected_sum) as Time_per_row_action,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

panels.title: Time Based Efficiency (Total)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(num_queries)/avg(period_length) as QPS,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime )
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/avg(period_length) as Load,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime )
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

panels.description: For READ Queries how much time is spent per Row Sent.  Values above 1ms tend to correspond to seriously inefficient system

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_query_time_sum*(m_rows_sent_sum>0))/sum(m_rows_sent_sum) as Time_per_row_sent,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

panels.title: READ Query Time Based Efficiency

panels.description: For READ Queries how many rows/sec is system able to crunch.  Low values tend to correspond to poor CPU performance,  Poor Cache efficiency, contention.  Higher values means "work" is being done more efficiently but it may be wrong work, for example scanning tables with no indexes

custom.axisLabel: Rows Examined per Query Exec Sec

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum*(m_rows_sent_sum>0))/sum(m_query_time_sum*(m_rows_sent_sum>0)) as Rows_Examined_QuerySec,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

panels.title: READ Query  Data Crunching Efficiency

panels.description: For WRITE Queries how much time is spent per Row Sent.  Values above 1ms tend to correspond to seriously inefficient system

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_query_time_sum*(m_rows_affected_sum>0))/sum(m_rows_affected_sum) as Time_per_row_affected,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

panels.title: WRITE Query Time Based Efficiency

panels.description: For WRITE Queries how many rows/sec is system able to crunch.  Low values tend to correspond to poor CPU performance,  Poor Cache efficiency, contention.  Higher values means "work" is being done more efficiently but it may be wrong work, for example scanning tables with no indexes

custom.axisLabel: Rows Examined per Query Exec Sec

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    period_start AS t,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum*(m_rows_affected_sum>0))/sum(m_query_time_sum*(m_rows_affected_sum>0)) as Rows_Examined_QuerySec,
    node_name
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) and service_type='mysql'
GROUP BY t,node_name
ORDER BY t

panels.title: WRITE Query  Data Crunching Efficiency

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    fingerprint,
    node_name as Host, schema "Schema",
    sum(num_queries)/(toUnixTimestamp($__toTime) - toUnixTimestamp($__fromTime))*1000 QPS,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt)*1000 as Latency_ms,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum)/sum(m_rows_sent_sum) as Rows_exam_per_sent
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime )
GROUP BY node_name,Schema,fingerprint
ORDER BY QPS desc limit 20

SELECT
    fingerprint, node_name as Host, schema "Schema",
    sum(num_queries)/(toUnixTimestamp($__toTime) - toUnixTimestamp($__fromTime))*1000 QPS,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt)*1000 as Latency_ms,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum)/sum(m_rows_sent_sum) as Rows_exam_per_sent
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime )
GROUP BY fingerprint,node_name,schema
ORDER BY Latency_ms desc limit 20

targets.formattedQuery: SELECT period_start AS t, count() FROM pmm.metrics WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime ) GROUP BY t ORDER BY t
targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    fingerprint,
    node_name as Host, schema "Schema",
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/(toUnixTimestamp($__toTime) - toUnixTimestamp($__fromTime))*1000 Load,
    sum(num_queries)/(toUnixTimestamp($__toTime) - toUnixTimestamp($__fromTime))*1000 QPS,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt)*1000 as Latency_ms,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum)/sum(m_rows_sent_sum) as Rows_exam_per_sent
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime )
GROUP BY  node_name,Schema,fingerprint
ORDER BY Load desc limit 20

SELECT
    fingerprint,node_name as Host, schema "Schema",
    sum(num_queries_with_errors) Errors,
    sum(num_queries)/(toUnixTimestamp($__toTime) - toUnixTimestamp($__fromTime))*1000 QPS,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt)*1000 as Latency_ms,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum)/sum(m_rows_sent_sum) as Rows_exam_per_sent
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime )
GROUP BY node_name, schema, fingerprint
Having Errors>0
ORDER BY Errors desc limit 20

SELECT
    fingerprint,node_name as Host, schema "Schema",
    sum(num_queries_with_warnings) Warnings,
    sum(num_queries)/(toUnixTimestamp($__toTime) - toUnixTimestamp($__fromTime))*1000 QPS,
    sum(m_query_time_sum)/sum(m_query_time_cnt)*1000 as Latency_ms,
    sum(m_rows_examined_sum)/sum(m_rows_sent_sum) as Rows_exam_per_sent
FROM pmm.metrics
WHERE ( period_start  >= $__fromTime AND period_start <= $__toTime )
GROUP BY fingerprint,node_name,schema
Having Warnings>0
ORDER BY Warnings desc limit 20

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT node_name from pmm.metrics where service_type='mysql'
list.name: NodeName
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT node_name from pmm.metrics where service_type='mysql'
list.rawSql: SELECT DISTINCT node_name from pmm.metrics where service_type='mysql'

title: RED Method for MySQL Queries - Designed for PMM2
